subject: resource/Adam_Stansfield
object: Adam Stansfield (10 September 1978 – 10 August 2010) was an English professional footballer who played as a striker.He began his career in non-league with Cullompton Rangers and Elmore, before signing his first professional contract at the age of 23 with Yeovil Town. He helped Yeovil to promotion into The Football League, as he later did with both Hereford United and Exeter City. He also won the 2002 FA Trophy Final with Yeovil, and promotion into League One with Exeter.
human_readable: The comment about Adam Stansfield is that he was an English professional footballer who played as a striker, began his career in non-league with Cullompton Rangers and Elmore, signed his first professional contract at the age of 23 with Yeovil Town, helped Yeovil to promotion into The Football League, later did so with both Hereford United and Exeter City, won the 2002 FA Trophy Final with Yeovil, and promoted into League One with Exeter.
